THE PRINCE ALBERT TIMES
AND SASKATCHEWAN REVIEW.

PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T., WEDNESDAY, APRIL 4, 1883.

E. FLOOD & CO., Bankers and Brokers.
North West Council Election.
PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T., Feb. 27, 1883

D. H. MACDOWALL, ESQ.,
Dean Street.

Sir,

We, the undersigned electors of the District of Lorne, having the fullest confidence in your integrity and ability to represent our interests at the North West Council, hereby pledge ourselves to use our utmost exertions to secure your election as a candidate to represent us at the ensuing election.

We respectfully request you to accept our nomination and assure you of our support and vote for you at the ensuing election.

We are,
Yours faithfully,

L. Clarke, Mayor North West.
C. Miller, Alderman.
Thomas McKeen, Alderman.
H. T. More, Alderman.
Philip Turner, Alderman.
M. McNaughton, Alderman.

REQUISITION
To D. H. MACDOWALL, ESQ.,
PRINCE ALBERT.

SOUTH BRANCH, March 18, 1883.

Sir,

We, the undersigned residents of the South Branch Settlement and surrounding country, having the highest confidence in your integrity and ability, respectfully request you to become a candidate to represent us at the ensuing election.

We are convinced that your character and qualifications make you the most suitable person to be elected to the North West Council, and we therefore respectfully request you to accept our nomination and assure you of our support and vote for you at the ensuing election.

We are,
Yours respectfully,

Edward Taylor, Alderman.
John H. Jackson, Alderman.
George Tate, Alderman.
William Evans, Alderman.
Philip Turner, Alderman.
Patrick Anderson, Alderman.
Francis Fournier, Alderman.
George W. Knowles, Alderman.

John Donaldson, Alderman.
Peter Campbell, Alderman.
Alexander McBeth, Alderman.
Jeremiah Stevens, Alderman.
J. E. W. Brown, Alderman.
Bernard Brewster, Alderman.

ATTENTION TRAVELLERS

Touchwood Hills House
This House is now open for the accommodation of the Public. Travellers will find that the proprietors are anxious to provide for all their wants, and that they will find good accommodation, both for themselves and their horses, at reasonable charges. The House is situated on the main road, and is easily reached by the stage coach from Prince Albert.

Large quantity of Hay on hand

LOUIS CONTURE, Proprietor.

CHESTER THOMPSON,
PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T.
THE PRINCE ALBERT TIMES

WEDNESDAY, APRIL 4, 1863.

SATURDAY'S MEETING.

No more exciting spectacle, no more humiliating exhibition, was ever before witnessed in Prince Albert than that presented by the proceedings at the meeting held on Saturday last. Even his fellow members were disgusted at his conduct; it is only charity that prevents us from saying that he was doing something worse than usual.

Conducted by Mr. Clarke, on every point, Mr. Kennedy's conduct was most praiseworthy. He seemed like a gallant jay every time he had descended. For an honourable member of the Assembly to be so unfitted, but for one whose own platform was a shade of abuse and vilification so unprofitable, would have been an act of charity, but the conduct of Dr. Porter excited him away and made him feel that he was not doing his duty.

His repeated interruptions of Mr. Clarke, his refusal to allow him to finish his speeches, his utter recklessness as to what he did or said, his disregard of the rules of order, his loud and boisterous manner, might have been found sympathies, but he utterly failed to make any impression whatever upon those who knew his position was most swaggering. Even his own followers could see that he was not doing his duty.

The Assembly adjourned without doing anything more than to vote a motion that the proceedings of Saturday should not be allowed to stand, and that the members present should be instructed to meet again next week.

Notice to Creditors.

In the Guards of Alexander Rederick Kennedy, deceased.

The Hudson's Bay Company own 7,000,000 acres in the Great Fertile Belt, and now offer for sale 500,000 acres, already surveyed by the Government of Canada.

ALSO

TOWN LOTS FOR SALE

In Winnipeg, West Lynne, Rat Portage, Portage la Prairie and Goshen, N.W.T.

The above will be disposed of at reasonable prices and on easy terms of payment. Full information in regard to these lands will be given at the offices of the Company in Winnipeg and Montreal.

C J BRYDIE, Land Commissioner.
MASS MEETING
Under Bust of the Porter Party

Mackay's Election Curtain.

The mass meeting arranged for last night under the Bust of the Porter Party was held at the Hall. Mr. Mackay, who had been invited by Mr. Porter, addressed the meeting. He spoke of the importance of the election and encouraged everyone to vote. The meeting ended with a vote of thanks to Mr. Mackay.
